__e: Also, I'd be happy to make a monetary contribution to your cause.
It's not only a contribution to that, but as the mayor said:
- not social contribution - it is easy to see why the state of the world is what it is today.
Sire, you have an absolute skill for encouraging contributions from the poor.
I got a convent education because of a big allowance from my mother's family.
Would a $500 a month subsidy for families make it easier for your banks to bite?
Anyone who sends in a $1 00 pledge will receive a personally autographed copy of my book.
I don't know, a contrib line is cool.
Apropos of which, I think another contribution is due.
His family's political contributions may not be enough... to buy a senator... but they are enough to rent them from time to time.
